data.title: Producer Price Index showed an unexpected increase in January, with headline prices rising 0.5% from the previous month and 2.9% year-over-year. Core PPI, excluding food and energy, surged 0.8% in January and 3.6% annually. Services led the rise, with prices increasing 0.8% in January, driven by a 14.4% spike in margins for professional and commercial equipment wholesaling. Goods prices, on the other hand, fell 0.3%. The data challenges the Fed's rate-cut timeline.
data.description: In January, the Producer Price Index (PPI) showed an unexpected increase, raising concerns about inflation and complicating the Federal Reserve's rate-cut plans. Monthly headline PPI rose by 0.5%, surpassing the 0.3% forecast and accelerating from December's 0.4%. Year-over-year figures showed a 2.9% increase, exceeding the 2.6% expectation. Core PPI, excluding food and energy, saw a significant 0.8% jump in January and reached a 3.6% yearly increase, outpacing forecasts. The surge was primarily driven by services, with final demand services rising by 0.8%, largely due to a 14.4% increase in margins for professional and commercial equipment wholesaling. Goods prices, however, fell by 0.3%. The article discusses these numbers further on Benzinga.com.

data.title: OpenAI secures $110B funding from Amazon, Nvidia, and SoftBank, fueling A.I. growth.
data.description: In a recent report, it was revealed that the global economy is projected to grow at a rate of 4.5% in the upcoming year. This growth is primarily driven by emerging markets, with a forecasted increase of 6.2%. Advanced economies are expected to see a growth rate of 3.9%. Additionally, global trade volumes are expected to rise by 6.8% in the same year. However, this growth is subject to various risks, including ongoing trade tensions and the possibility of financial market disruptions. Overall, the outlook for the global economy remains positive, but uncertainties persist.

data.title: FIGS stock surges post strong Q4 results, with earnings at 10 cents per share (estimated 2 cents) and revenue surpassing expectations by 22% to $201.9 million. KeyBanc upgrade to Overweight boosts rally.
data.description: Shares of FIGS Inc (NYSE: FIGS) are surging as the healthcare-apparel company reported a strong fourth-quarter performance that exceeded Wall Street forecasts. Earnings of 10 cents per share greatly surpassed the estimated 2 cents and showed significant growth from the previous year's 1 cent. Additionally, revenue reached $201.9 million, exceeding expectations by over 22%. This positive momentum led to FIGS stock nearing key resistance levels. The rally was further fueled by KeyBanc upgrading the stock from Sector Weight to Overweight. These impressive earnings results and positive analyst actions have propelled FIGS shares to new highs.

data.title: Barclays explores blockchain for banking services like payments & deposits amidst growing stablecoin use.
data.description: A UK financial institution is currently looking for a tech collaborator to assist with blockchain-based transactions as the use of stablecoins grows rapidly in the financial and technology sectors.

data.title: Booking Holdings to present at Morgan Stanley conference; corrections made to initial news release issued on 27-Feb-2026.
data.description: Booking Holdings Inc. will be participating in the Morgan Stanley Technology, Media & Telecom Conference, as announced on 27-Feb-2026. The update was issued by Booking Holdings through PR Newswire. The company disclosed that modifications have been implemented. More details can be found in the revised release.

data.title: Northeastern Illinois University will host 12th Annual GHRAD Conference with speakers from North America and Africa. Keynote by Dr. Mamphela Ramphele.
data.description: A conference set to take place will showcase speakers hailing from various regions in North America and Africa, with a notable keynote address to be delivered by Mamphela Ramphele, Ph.D. The event, the 12th Annual Genocide and Human Rights in Africa and the Diaspora (GHRAD) conference, is organized by Northeastern Illinois University. Scheduled for February 27, 2026 in Chicago, the conference aims to shed light on crucial issues related to genocide and human rights, drawing attention to important topics affecting global communities.

data.title: Children’s Hospital LA begins 11th Make March Matter campaign, recognizing businesses committing $12,500+ for CHLA's 125th anniversary.
data.description: In Los Angeles, Children's Hospital LA launched their 11th edition by recognizing various businesses for their commitment to raising funds on the occasion of the hospital's 125th anniversary. The following companies were honored and included in the 125th Anniversary Club for pledging $12,500 or more: Agent Nateur, Alfred, Alltroo, Babylist, Chicco, Delta Air Lines, Eataly, GUESS Foundation, Irene Neuwirth, LA Kings, Los Angeles Marathon, Nuna, Pampers, Porto's Bakery and Café, and Prologis.

data.title: InventHelp client invents modification for metal bullnose, called NO MORE SAND BULLNOSE, ensures clean finish.
data.description: In Pittsburgh on February 27, 2026, an inventor from Truth Or Consequence, New Mexico, shared their inspiration behind the creation of the NO MORE SAND BULLNOSE. Expressing the need for protection and a clean finish with metal bullnose, the inventor sought a modification to address this concern. This innovation aims to offer a solution for ensuring a pristine finish consistently.

data.title: UFP Technologies to attend Raymond James Conference on Mar 1-4, 2026. Chairman and CEO to present at 2:50 PM on March 3rd. Webcast link for presentation available.
data.description: In Newburyport, Massachusetts, on February 27, 2026, UFP Technologies, Inc. (Nasdaq: UFPT), a company specializing in single-use and single-patient medical devices, shared news of Chairman and CEO R. Jeffrey Bailly and CFO Ron Lataille's involvement in the upcoming Raymond James 47th Annual Institutional Investors Conference in Orlando, Florida from March 1-4, 2026. UFP's presentation is set for 2:50 PM on Tuesday, March 3rd, with a live webcast accessible for viewing.

data.title: Bitcoin has dropped 26% in a month, but large wallet holders are increasing, nearing 20,000 with 100 BTC each, valued at $6.78 million per wallet, signaling accumulation by big players.
data.description: Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) has experienced a 26% decrease in value in the last month, however, on-chain data indicates a continuous increase in the number of large wallet holders which is often associated with accumulation phases. The number of wallets containing at least 100 BTC is nearing 20,000, with each wallet holding around $6.78 million at current prices according to Santiment data. These wallets are typically connected to wealthy individuals, funds, long-term holders, or institutions. The rise in the number of wallets holding 100+ BTC during a price decline is seen as a positive sign, suggesting that major players are accumulating assets.

data.title: Poposoap's campaign for World Wildlife Day aims to transform backyards into wildlife-friendly spaces, starting March 3.
data.description: On February 27, 2026, Poposoap announced a new campaign in honor of World Wildlife Day on March 3. The initiative aims to transform backyards into easy-to-maintain wildlife-friendly spaces. With a focus on starting conservation efforts at home, the campaign encourages people to create habitats that support local wildlife. This initiative underlines the idea that small steps in individual backyards can collectively make a significant impact on global biodiversity.

data.title: Venture Global signs 20-year deal with Hanwha Aerospace to supply 1.5 MTPA of LNG from 2030, expanding global market presence.
data.description: Shares of Venture Global (NYSE: VG) are on the rise on Friday morning after the company announced a new 20-year partnership with Hanwha Aerospace. This marks their first collaboration with a Korean entity and is aimed at enhancing their LNG supply capabilities in Asia. The agreement involves the purchase of 1.5 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) of U.S. liquefied natural gas starting in 2030. This deal, expected to bolster Venture Global's presence in the global energy market, brings their long-term contracted portfolio to over 46 MTPA. CEO Mike Sabel expressed enthusiasm for the partnership, citing the importance of reliable, low-cost American LNG to address the increasing global energy demand and fortify strategic energy alliances. This move comes as Venture Global stock faces downward pressure, prompting speculation on its future performance.
